p:
This expression captures how the utility for risky sex, in the presence of HAART, is a function of both utility for unprotected sex without the availability of HAART ( U
US ) and the utility of unprotected sex if HAART is available to them ( U
US + d), weighted according to the perceived availability of HAART in the population ( ρ modified by misperception of true HAART coverage, k). By adjusting the utility, the choices made by individuals are altered and risky sex is perceived as more attractive under HAART.
